avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs above the tree line. The avalanche danger will increase during the day, reaching danger level 3 (considerable).
avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow of the last two days as well as the wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in many places. Gradual increase in avalanche danger as the snowfall becomes more intense.

In isolated cases the dry avalanches are large and can be released easily by a single winter sport participant, caution is to be exercised in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, as well as adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas above approximately 2100 m.

Faceted weak layers exist in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.
Avalanches can be released in near-ground layers and reach quite a large size. This applies in particular in little used terrain along the border with France.

The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The fresh snow and the wind slabs are lying on a crust below approximately 2300 m.
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas at elevated altitudes only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Significant increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of new snow and wind.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow and very particularly the sometimes deep wind slabs can be released easily, or, in isolated cases naturally above the tree line, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses.

Dry avalanches can be triggered in the old snowpack and reach large size in isolated cases in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation.
Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls. This also applies in areas where the snow cover is rather shallow.

Backcountry touring calls for experience and restraint.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
In all altitude zones from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.highlights: The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs represent the main danger.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh and older wind slabs can be released easily or naturally above approximately 1800 m, caution is to be exercised adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas, as well as at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example.
In isolated cases the avalanches can be released in the faceted old snow and reach large size.

In little used terrain the situation is rather unfavourable.
Backcountry touring calls for caution and restraint.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2000 m, depending on the infuence of the wind.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas at elevated altitudes hardly any snow is lying.
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on old snow containing large grains.

avalancheActivity.highlights: The fresh snow and in particular the wind slabs that are forming above the tree line represent the main danger.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow and very particularly the mostly small wind slabs can be released easily, or, in isolated cases naturally above the tree line, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.

The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses, in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation in particular.

Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
